title: WCAS PSYCH 205-0-23 Research Methods in Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Psychological science allows us to make observations about the world and then empirically test them using the scientific method. The main purpose of this course is to provide you with the framework and mindset to think like a social scientist and the tools to study psychological questions. The focus of this course will be on critical thinking skills and analytical skills, each applied to the question of how to advance science incrementally. Although most examples in the course will be drawn from social psychology, the skills taught in this class are not content-specific and can be applied to any course within psychology. Students will learn about the social science approach to conducting research, including ethical standards, methods employed, and communicating science to a variety of audiences from peers to non-academics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will be evaluated on their knowledge of conducting behavioral research as assessed by three research reports and a midterm exam. Content will be drawn from both a textbook and peer-reviewed articles.
